The_Steel_Woods:
{{Short description|American country music group}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = The Steel Woods | image = Main Photo - Shot by @colecreasy.jpg | landscape = yes | alt = | caption = Wes Bayliss, Tyler Powers and Johnny Stanton | alias = | origin = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], United States | genre = {{hlist|[[Country music|Country]]|[[southern rock]]|[[Bluegrass music|bluegrass]]|[[Americana (music)|Americana]]}} | years_active = 2016–present | label = {{hlist|Woods Music|[[Thirty Tigers]]}} | associated_acts = {{flatlist| *[[Jamey Johnson]], [[Brent Cobb]] }} | website = {{URL|http://thesteelwoods.com}} | current_members = Wes Bayliss
Johnny Stanton
Tyler Powers
| past_members = Jason "Rowdy" Cope
Jay Tooke }} '''The Steel Woods''' are an American [[country music]] group.{{Citation |date=May 9, 2017 |title=10 New Country Artists You Need to Know: May 2017 |magazine=[[Rolling Stone]] |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/country/lists/10-new-country-artists-you-need-to-know-may-2017-w481172/steel-woods-w481175 |access-date=September 19, 2017 }} from [[Nashville, Tennessee]].{{Citation |last=Stroud |first=Scott |date=June 1, 2017 |title=Review: The Steel Woods honor southern rock tradition |publisher=[[Associated Press]] |url=http://www.news-sentinel.com/20170601/review-the-steel-woods-honor-southern-rock-tradition&profile=1042M |access-date= September 19, 2017}} Their debut album, ''Straw in the Wind'', was released in 2017.{{Cite web|url=https://www.kmuw.org/post/steel-woods-plead-civility-old-news|title=The Steel Woods Plead For Civility With 'Old News'|last=Beaudoin|first=Jedd|website=www.kmuw.org|date=19 June 2019 |language=en|access-date=2020-04-16}} The band has cited influences such as [[Willie Nelson]], [[Waylon Jennings]] and [[Led Zeppelin]],{{Cite web|url=https://www.wideopencountry.com/artist-to-watch-the-steel-woods/|title=Band to Watch: The Steel Woods, One of Southern Rock's New Revivalists|last=Burchard|first=Jeremy|date=2017-05-17|website=Wide Open Country|language=en-US|access-date=2020-04-16}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.popmatters.com/the-steel-woods-straw-in-the-wind-2495386212.html|title=The Steel Woods: Straw in the Wind|date=2017-07-19|website=PopMatters|language=en|access-date=2020-04-16}} and have toured [[Opening act|in support]] of artists such as [[Lynyrd Skynyrd]], [[Dwight Yoakam]], [[Jamey Johnson]], [[Cody Jinks]], [[Miranda Lambert]], and [[Blackberry Smoke]].{{Cite web|url=https://bozone.com/interview-steel-woods-live-divide-eagles-bozeman-june-2019/|title=Interview: Steel Woods @ Live Divide/Eagles Bozeman – June 2019|date=2019-06-14|website=The BoZone|language=en-US|access-date=2020-04-16}} Founding member and guitarist Jason "Rowdy" Cope died on January 16, 2021.{{Cite magazine |last=Hudak |first=Joseph |date=2021-05-20 |title=The Metalhead Who Played Country Guitar |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/jason-rowdy-cope-steel-woods-all-of-your-stones-1172058/ |access-date=2022-09-10 |magazine=Rolling Stone |language=en-US}} == History == The Steel Woods were cofounded by Wes Bayliss and Jason "Rowdy" Cope. Cope was the creative lead of the band as well as its [[lead guitar]]ist, songwriter and co-producer, while Bayliss is a multi-instrumentalist, lead singer and co-producer.{{Cite web |date=2019-02-04 |title=Hotstar: The Steel Woods Build A Career Show By Show - Pollstar News |url=https://news.pollstar.com/2019/02/04/hotstar-the-steel-woods-build-a-career-show-by-show/ |access-date=2022-09-12 |language=en-US}} Bayliss grew up in [[Woodland, Alabama]], playing music in his family's gospel band and learned to play harmonica, mandolin, and guitar. In 2007, he moved to [[Mobile, Alabama]], where he experimented further on different instruments. Cope began to learn guitar at the age of 11 in his hometown of [[Asheville, North Carolina]]. He later worked as a [[Los Angeles]]-based musician before moving to [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]] in 2007 and joined [[Jamey Johnson]]'s band. In his nine years with Johnson, Cope co-wrote "Can't Cash My Checks" and helped Johnson make the [[Grammy Award|Grammy]]-nominated "[[That Lonesome Song]]" (2008) and "[[The Guitar Song]]" (2010).{{Cite web|url=https://www.pisgahbrewing.com/shows/the-steel-woods/|title=The Steel Woods|last=Pisgah|first=Brewing|date=July 29, 2019|website=Pisgah Brewing|access-date=April 16, 2020|archive-date=April 8, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170408015228/http://www.pisgahbrewing.com/shows/the-steel-woods/|url-status=dead}} In the early days of The Steel Woods, Bayliss and Cope spent a lot of time fishing and writing what would eventually evolve into the bands first studio album, ''Straw in the Wind'' (2017) released on [[Thirty Tigers]]/Woods Music. The album featured a guest vocal appearance by [[Lindi Ortega]], and [[Brent Cobb]] also contributed as a songwriter. On June 10, 2017, it reached number 42 on the [[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] Independent Albums chart.{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/independent-albums/2017-06-09|title=Independent Albums Chart|magazine=Billboard|access-date=2020-04-16}} In the subsequent years, the band toured with fellow [[Southern rock]] artists [[Cody Johnson]], [[Cody Jinks]], [[Whiskey Myers]], and [[Blackberry Smoke]] as well as inspirations such as [[Lynyrd Skynyrd]] and [[Miranda Lambert]].{{Cite web |title=The Steel Woods – MoxieTalk with Kirt Jacobs |url=https://moxietalk.com/episodes/thesteelwoods/ |access-date=2020-04-16 |website=MoxieTalk |language=en-US}} They recorded their second album, ''Old News'', in [[Asheville, North Carolina|Asheville]] at the site of an old church during a break in their touring schedule. The album was released on January 18, 2019.{{Cite web|url=https://glidemagazine.com/218932/southern-rockers-the-steel-woods-take-a-big-leap-forward-with-riveting-old-news-album-review/ | title=Southern Rockers The Steel Woods Take a Big Leap Forward|website=glidemagazine.com| date=17 January 2019|access-date=2020-04-16}} Cope died in January 2021. The band's third album, ''All of Your Stones'', was released in May 2021.{{cite web|url=https://americansongwriter.com/review-the-steel-woods-new-album-is-sadly-a-final-testament-to-its-late-co-founder/|title=Review: The Steel Woods' New Album Is Sadly A Final Testament To {{sic|I|t's|nolink=y}} Late Co-Founder|work=[[American Songwriter]]|last=Horowitz|first=Hal|date=May 12, 2021|access-date=May 14, 2021}} On March 28, 2024, Wes Bayliss announced that after the completion of a final United States tour throughout 2024, The Steel Woods would disband, citing personal reasons to end the band and cancelling a scheduled autumn 2024 UK and European tour with fellow Southern rockers [[Blackberry Smoke]].{{Cite web |title=The Steel Woods Announce They’ll Stop Touring At The End Of 2024 |url=https://www.msn.com/en-us/music/news/the-steel-woods-announce-they-ll-stop-touring-at-the-end-of-2024/ar-BB1kH9nY |access-date=2024-03-29 |website=www.msn.com}} ==Personnel == * Wes Bayliss – guitar and vocals * Jason Cope – guitar (d. 2021) * Johnny Stanton – bassist * Tyler Powers – guitar * Isaac Senty - drummer ==Discography== '''Albums''' *''Straw in the Wind'' (2017) *''Old News'' (2019) *''All of Your Stones'' (2021) *On Your Time (2023) ==See also== * [[List of country music performers]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [https://open.spotify.com/artist/69B1gu9EjC0rNb59YYNVPM Spotify] * [https://itunes.apple.com/us/artist/the-steel-woods/1073094331?ign-gact=3&ls=1 Apple Music] * [https://www.pandora.com/station/play/4477864228065669439 Pandora] * [https://play.google.com/music/listen#/wst/artist/A46com75qthwwdnm4wr2arjlvci Google Play Music] * {{Discogs artist|The Steel Woods}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Steel Woods, The}} [[Category:American country rock groups]] [[Category:Musical groups established in 2016]] [[Category:2016 establishments in Tennessee]] [[Category:Musical groups from Nashville, Tennessee]]
